definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: What Beijing will do about the unofficial financial system is anyone's guess at this point.
sentences.chinese: 北京如何处理这些非官方债务，任谁都猜得到。

sentences.english: This is not even including the non-official members.
sentences.chinese: 这还卟苞括非官方哙员。

sentences.english: We have detected problems with the Water Mark in some Non Official OS.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测操作系统的问题与非官方的一些水迹。

sentences.english: The statement is unofficial and not binding on either country.
sentences.chinese: 本声明系非官方性的，对两国均不具有约束力。

sentences.english: There existed a small “nonstate” trade network.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯有一个非官方贸易网络。

sentences.english: Non- designated languages are languages for which there are no state certifying examinations.
sentences.chinese: 非官方指定语言是没有州政府认证考试的语言。

sentences.english: Easter Monday is generally regarded as an unofficial consecration of Spring.
sentences.chinese: 复活节一般被认为是一种非官方的春节圣祭日。

sentences.english: Conversely, unofficial information on social media is often more credible.
sentences.chinese: 相反的，社会媒体的非官方消息常常更加可信。

sentences.english: The use of non-government email services to conduct official business has been criticised in the past.
sentences.chinese: 使用非官方邮件和政府进行业务往来的行为久遭诟病。

sentences.english: But the NMSP could not accept such an unofficial offer.
sentences.chinese: 但新孟邦党不能接受这样一个非官方提议。

definition: government/official (approved or issued by an authority)
official website (abbr. for 官方網站|官方网站[guan1 fang1 wang3 zhan4])
to release/to issue/to announce/to distribute/also written 發布|发布[fa1 bu4]
